website_summaries.verdict: Big, powerful, full-featured mower offers excellent value.
pros: If you don’t mind the cord, this mower has everything
3-in-1 discharge, 7 cutting heights, big wheels for easy maneuverability, folding handle for compact storage
All the power you need at a bargain price
cons: A few owners have experienced motor faults

website_summaries.verdict: It may not be the most modern or innovative mower, but there's no doubt it represents good value for your money.
pros: Larger rear wheels make it easy to maneuver, and you have the option of a rear bag, mulching, or side ejection
cons: Needs to be pushed, but it does have powered cutting

customer_reviews.title: Great lawnmower. Plenty of power using a heavy duty ...
customer_reviews.text: Great lawnmower. Plenty of power using a heavy duty 12 gauge extension cord. Gotta go slow over tall grass, & make sure it's dry after rain or watering. Very convenient & easy for 69 year old semi-disabled female (5'5" tall 168 lbs) to operate. Just take great care to keep the extension cord out of mowing path, & away from tangling in your feet. Be vigilant about this & just mow away!...without the need to pull start & without the need for a man to get it going. Just push the button, pull up on the handle lever & off you go. No worries...in a jiffy, your lawn is easily mowed & beautiful again. :) jlp
customer_reviews.author: :) jlp

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after a month!
customer_reviews.text: I had the same issue as some other people reported. It worked only for a couple of time. Smoke came form the motor and since then it stopped working. Haven't been able to get the hold of the company for warranty. Based on what I have experienced I do not recommend you buying this product. ****** update: I contacted the service department and they said I didn't use the proper extension cord. Expedition cord should be 15 Amps while I used 10 Amps cord. They will send me a replacement unit. I'll order a new cord and will update this review later.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: light duty cheap plastic construction
customer_reviews.text: Nice and light, easy to move around, but the plastic parts that holds the bearing or motor are very weak. On only the second use, after hitting something in the grass, some plastic part gave way the motor is no longer held in place.... The unit is unusable.  signed: Shel
customer_reviews.author: Dasha18

customer_reviews.title: ... this to work since I take no pride writing bad reviews. However
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted this to work since I take no pride writing bad reviews, and quite a few customers have had some positive views . However, it failed to start on several tries. I even used a different power cord, tried a few other products on the same outlet, and all worked well. Additionally, If I was able to reach support after a long hold, maybe this would have been a better review. Thank you Amazon, it is on its way back....
customer_reviews.author: MY-VU

customer_reviews.title: Best lawnmower EVER!!!
customer_reviews.text: You purchased this item on April 24, 2013. So I have been using and totally abusing this lawn mower since 2013 and it has never once failed to work and work perfectly. I have NEVER had such an exceptional lawn mower. As you can see from my picture it goes through my jungle like a hot knife through butter. If you are thinking about this - buy it. You will not be sorry... Update 7-18-2020: Still going strong even though I keep it in an unheated shed. Great lawn mower!
customer_reviews.author: Allan Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Woman's Perspective: Great! Would recommend!
customer_reviews.text: From a woman's perspective: Received early, very easy to assemble and use, a little heavy to push up inclines but cut the grass well. The only con is that when you attach the catch bag, grass does blow back out on top of the mower where the flap attaches. As far as using a cord, it's just like vacuuming your lawn lol. Would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Beautiful Jasmine

customer_reviews.title: Tackles the hardest jobs like a riding mower!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this because we needed a mower that we can use occasionally and didn't want to futz around with gasoline. We seeded a new lawn and it was already 8 inches tall...plus it rained the day before we mowed and the lawn was damp. We debated waiting for dry weather, but we had a free afternoon. Wow!! This baby cut right through damp, long grass like butter. Yes, there was a little sputtering when things gunked up with wet grass, but it never quit, and did an AMAZING job! I am so impressed that even with this inappropriate use, the mower performed like a champ. Nothing but good things to say about this lawn mower.
customer_reviews.author: Desert Son

customer_reviews.title: Machine won't come on start button won't make a click down
customer_reviews.text: Good Afternoon, I purchased an electric mower and a trimmer from your company through amazon. Tried to turn on d mower after installation and following d guide lines on YouTube but my machine still won't come on. At this point I am very disappointed with the equipment and frustrated with the amount of time spent trying to make the mower work. If feels the start button does not make a click when u press it down and pull d other lever up towards the handle. Not happy at all what do I do next?
customer_reviews.author: John o

customer_reviews.title: Hmmm...it broke first use.
customer_reviews.text: There needs to be another rating for “it works”. I would have marked that 1 star. We mowed the back yard and the front yard made it about 6 feet and it totally quit. Literally right out of the box. Requesting refund now. Will hump up to 2-3 stars if that process is smooth.
customer_reviews.author: Derek E. Gillaspy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to start and it cuts great!! So happy!
customer_reviews.text: Who would think a 70 yr young woman could be so pleased with a lawn mower? Two weeks later I love this!! Week one I got an F in cord maneuvering but yesterday after watching a couple of you-tube videos with this same mower, I got an A!! Couldn’t be easier to attach the handles- starting is a breeze, and it works fabulously!! Have about 1/4 acre but the back yard is a slope. I mowed sideways and it was very easy. This is a win-win all the way around!
customer_reviews.author: Skiebird

customer_reviews.title: Died after using five times!
customer_reviews.text: I am absolutely furious with this product! I purchased in September and used it about five times, put it in the shed for the winter, pulled it out yesterday and it won't start! I'm contacting their customer support to see what they can do to fix it.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Beats the help out of gas powered mower
customer_reviews.text: I have used this lawn mower for 3 years on a large area of my property.The property is in the foothills of the Smoky Mountains.I have shale and trees all over and run over it.It keeps on going.I plug it in push the button to start it and it does a good job every time.And I sometimes I use 3-4 extension cord and it does not miss a beat.That is over 300 feet of extension cord.I all never buy another gas powered outside tool again.Too much upkeep and very short life.I finally am ordering a new blade for $21,this original blade was chewed pretty good.If I ever have to,I will buy the mower
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Its NOT always greener on the otherside
customer_reviews.text: Saw all the great reviews they had and figured hey what the heck why not so went ahead and purchased it. Everything seemed to be going well and just recently i noticed that the bag has a hole in it, not only does the bag have a whole but so does the rubber thing that sweeps grass clippings. I take care of this machine and it stays in the garage im just wondering if its just really fragile or was it manufacturers error. Im really bummed about this purchase and wish someone can really help me out here.
customer_reviews.author: The Don

customer_reviews.title: It stopped working less than 2 months after purchase. $165 waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: I attempted to contact the manufacturer on their "free help line" 3 times without success. I emailed them 7 days ago, per their "free help line" on-hold instructions. Their automated response says, "While under normal circumstances we estimate a response delay of approximately 24-48 business hours, however we apologise that you may experience a much higher than normal response time, as we are currently receiving a very high volume of emails." Customer support can work from home so Covid-19 IS NOT A FACTOR in providing support for my $165 waste of money. This product is garbage and the company's efforts and promises are empty. I threw the $165 "business lesson" in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: T. Lorz

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I was really disappointed to receive this mower. Plugged it in and nothing. It doesn’t turn on, doesn’t work. It looks beautiful, I don’t like to write bad reviews, I really wanted to give greenworks a chance to make it right but I received the mower on Saturday and called and emailed everyday for the past 48 hours and can’t talk to any customer service people. I bought another brand for 15 years and saw the reviews and was really exited to try this. Just disappointing, no customer service. I will return it, you might have better luck then me, the mower looks great.
customer_reviews.author: Muck

customer_reviews.title: Worst Customer Support Ever - yes even worse than Comcast
customer_reviews.text: The cams are stripped and I am missing a nut (jokes not necessary). I have called the customer 'support' line on 3 occasions and waited over 15 minutes. Only once did I get too speak to someone and they were not helpful. So, I have a really neat looking paperweight in my garage. Avoid this company at all costs. Lousy product and no customer support. I should have returned it while I was still in the window. Would give zero stars if possible. Update: Still have not received replacement parts. Also, it is falling apart. Other nuts/bolts have fallen out and I can't use the mower. Total waste of money. Too bad the return window has closed. Really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Bazil

customer_reviews.title: Weak and noisy.
customer_reviews.text: This mower has a weak motor and is noisy and doesn't cut well. I've had two different electric mowers and the motors were strong and they cut well. This one is so weak it bogs down constantly and can't handle much. I've had a worx that was so much more powerful at the same amperage rated motor. They must use a super cheap motor that doesn't have enough power. Horrible mower would never buy again and need to replace because it works so poorly. Definitely not worth the money. The positive reviews must be fakes because this mower is the worst.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Prior to getting this, I had a push mower because I didn't have a lot of grass to cut but after struggling with that for a few months, I bit the bullet and purchased this mower. I love it, I never thought I would get excited about a mower but when it arrived I was excited to try it out. It's very light weight and easy to use. I hate gas mowers as they add more pollution to the air. This is the best lawn mower and I recommend this highly to anyone looking for one.
customer_reviews.author: Pyoko

customer_reviews.title: Very happy!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. I was worried about it being powerful enough to tackle some high grass. It did take two passes, first on high then the second lower with the bag to collect the clippings. As far as noise it is quieter than a gas mower but not silent. Feels sturdy and wouldn't surprise me if it lasted awhile with proper maintenance. And yes the bag is small and needs to be emptied frequently, but not q problem at all.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Paynter

customer_reviews.title: Stopped after one summer (5 monoths of use)
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mower from Amazon on May 10, 2019 and it worked well for the rest of that summer and the beginning of this one. Then, on June 9th, 2020, it wouldn't start. It feels like something in the switch compartment isn't working, as the bar that must be moved back before pushing the start button no longer has tension on it. In short, this is an unreliable machine that doesn't hold up. I wouldn't buy it again, and advise you not to, either.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Low cooling flow for armature
customer_reviews.text: This unit is well built and would be adequate if the motor armature were better ventilated. If wet grass is being cut or if the bag is full, the little impeller above the grass cutting blade does not deliver enough cooling air flow into the little louvers in the motor casing bottom to adequately cool the armature. We have lost the oem motor and one replacement even knowing that electric motors need to run at one speed and with cooling. Even a breaker likely would not protect this unit enough. Do not purchase this if you will need to cut real grass. We plan to try electric one more time, a 16 inch, 13 amp Ryobi. Wish me luck?
customer_reviews.author: coffee drinker

customer_reviews.title: No customer service from greenworks - DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: I bought this late last summer and used it a couple of times. It worked fine. This May I tried to use it for the first mow of the year but it didn't work. I checked the cord, plug, etc but nothing made it work. i tried calling the greenworks 800 number several times starting on May 21 but got no answer. I sent three emails to the customer service site and as of today, June 12, I have heard nothing. So I have a useless lawn mower with a 4 year warranty and no access to the manufacturer to get it fixed or replaced. What a waste of money! DO NOT BUY FROM THIS COMPANY.
customer_reviews.author: charlottemax

customer_reviews.title: Four years later, I still love this mower!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the corded version of this mower in August of 2014. It was used when I bought it, and still, I have no complaints about this mower! I have a medium sized suburban lot in North Louisiana to mow, and it tackles it without complaint. I've never sharpened the blades or done a lick of maintenance on this machine (probably not recommend, but whatever) and it's never given me an issue. I love that I don't have to deal with gasolind or cranking the machine or smelling like gasoline. It's relatively quiet and all you have to do is plug it in and push the button. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: I am pretty sure I would have overheated a gas engine
customer_reviews.text: I destroyed a forest today with this thing. Weeds about 12-24" high for about 7,500 sqft. I had to stop and clean the bottom of it a lot of times but with weeds that thick I don't blame it. I am pretty sure I would have overheated a gas engine. To me, even if this thing broke down today after mowing (which it didn't) I would've understood. I cannot say good enough things about this thing. People writing bad reviews probably got a bad unit because this thing is solid. the weeds were moist too so water didn't seem an issue. Don't submerge.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: I'm impressed.
customer_reviews.text: Much higher quality than the B&D corded mower I was replacing. Easy to assemble, doesn't bog down in tall grass, the grass catcher works well and is easy to attach. What more could you ask for? Do yourself a favor and get a beefy, large gauge extension cord to go with this mower. It really does help.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew N

customer_reviews.title: KNOW WHAT YOU'RE IN FOR
customer_reviews.text: I found myself wanting to love this little mower so much, but I've used it three times now and it has not gotten any easier. I know now that I have, for sure, made a huge mistake. The cord is constantly in the way. You're throwing it to the left out of the way, turn around to come back, now you have to throw it the other way. It's just impossible. I'll have to wait until it's dark out to mow because it is that embarrassing!!! GRRRR
customer_reviews.author: 13beans

customer_reviews.title: 3 years and still going strong
customer_reviews.text: I've used this mower through the 2016, 2017, 2018, and now into the 2019 seasons in Maryland. I've performed 0 maintence other than blowing it off. The only thing worn has been the foam handle cover that I taped over. I was shopping for a replacement blade (also easy to find on Amazon and only a little over 20 bucks) and realized I didn't leave a review. If you want to cut your grass in normal intervals(once a week in most cases), this mower does a great job. Long time gas mower user before this and I don't think I will EVER go back unless I have a lawn that a 100' extension cord won't cover.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher R. Tinker

customer_reviews.title: Great quiet mower with plenty of power
customer_reviews.text: Used this lawnmower for the first time today. It cut my grass exactly as I needed it to. Strong enough and quite. The cord takes some getting used to but once you devil your routine you don’t think twice. I enjoyed mowing today and glad I went with this mower. Great deal and hard to pass up.
customer_reviews.author: John D.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing. Would return if I could
customer_reviews.text: Extremely disappointed in this lawn mower. It keeps blowing the fuse on our house. Customer service is impossible to get ahold of... waited on the phone for hours with no answer or option for them to call me back. Emailed and have not gotten an answer. Frustrated that this is past the extended return window that amazon was offering. Purchased during COVID, and by the time we got to use it, it only performed well once or twice.
customer_reviews.author: Sally Oster

customer_reviews.title: Weak motor
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what kind of grass they used when they built my home but it is not typical yard grass. It's like a super thick carpet of grass that turns brown after you cut it for a couple days.... Anyhow, the mower only works well on the highest grass setting. I have to run it over the lawn multiple times while slowly adjusting the height down to the middle. Any lower than middle height and the grass stops the mower completely. It struggles and last time I used it the motor was smoking a little so I don't know how much longer this thing will last.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: A solid corded mower
customer_reviews.text: This is my second electric mower. My first was a tiny, plastic mower. It was very light and easy to carry. But the plastic deck eventually showed stress marks. The wheels became wiggly. I switched to this wider, more powerful mower. The metal deck is heavier. The motor is more powerful. I can store the mower "upright", resting on two wheels. The plastic mower would warp if I did this. To sum it up. Solid construction. As poweful as an electric mower can be. Lots of metal components holding the machine together. Cuts nicely. Quiet. Mulches. Not too heavy. I have no complaints after using it for one season.
customer_reviews.author: Active Man

customer_reviews.title: Garbage mower
customer_reviews.text: I had this thing for a few months but only used it three times. I can't use it anymore because it kicks off the breaker panel anytime I try to turn it on. I 'm using a 15A power cord (125 volt, 1875 watt) that cost $70 that worked the first three times. I swapped with 2 other extension cords to get the same result. The wall outlet works fine with anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My man loves this mower
customer_reviews.text: I have a small yard. My guy takes care of my lawn and used to complain that my push mower sucked...he was beyond delighted with Greenworks-20 arrived. He said it was easy to set-up and it works great!!! So far so good, it's a new toy:)
customer_reviews.author: Linda G.

customer_reviews.title: Best Lawn Mower i have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I owned it for a few months and so far so good. I used to have battery operated one but the battery gone bad after two years and i had to charge the battery 3-4 times before i finish my mowing job. I did not like the gas one so i opted with the corded one and i made the right choice. It works great for me, i dont have to charge battery and it has wider blades and i like the way it cut the grass is like continuous cut unlike my old mower where other parts of the lawn are not cut propery or longer than the other parts. Highy recommended
customer_reviews.author: Ansi Cartman

customer_reviews.title: so easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: My wife wanted a lightweight and easy to use lawn mower. She had no interest in dealing with gas so she picked this one out. I wasn't sold on it but she ordered it anyways. She has mowed the lawn many times now and hasn't complained. I have used it also and the cord didn't bother me as much as I thought that it would. As long as you make sure to move away from wherever it is plugged in, instead of closer with each pass, it is very easy and convenient to use.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Shatanoff

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working the 2nd time i used it. I contacted the manufacturer 10 days ago and have not received a response. Even if it hadn't broken, it felt cheap. I have a power washer by this brand that i love, but do not recommend this mower.
customer_reviews.author: Tex Burrito

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 9 months, POOR customer service, unresponsive
customer_reviews.text: Loved the lawnmower, but it broke after 9 months (only used 2 dozen times). I contacted Greenworks about our broken lawnmower 10 days ago, and I have not received any help. I am very frustrated that I cannot mow my lawn, and it could be another few weeks before Greenworks contacts me and arranges for a repair.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Lawn Mower
customer_reviews.text: This mower meets exactly what I bot it for... Plenty of power and easy to move around. Also easy to clean the base after mowing... I am using it in mulching mode... so no waste to remove after I mow. I have no problems with it and am completely happy with it. I already had a 100 ft. cord and so I put it to work immediately after it was assembled. I am mainly using it to cut weeds growing along my long driveway since I no real lawn out here in the countryside. I highly recommend it to anyone with available power outlets near where the mowing is to be done!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, solid performer
customer_reviews.text: Bought this almost 3 years ago and have had no problems. Was easy to set up, easy height adjustment, easy bag installation and removal, easy to fold the handle for storage. It does a good job mowing our modest suburban front and back lawn. Note that the motor does get bogged down a little in taller/thicker grass, or when the bag reaches 3/4 full and begins to block the chute. So if you have a very large or very thick lawn, this might not be for you. Be sure to use properly sized power cord, also.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So Light, and Easy to push!
customer_reviews.text: Oh My Goodnessssssssss My thoughts were: This stupid thing better work. Let me be the one to say - It does! Don't second guess your dissision to get one. This mower is Awesome. I just bought a "garden home" The front and back yard are small-ish (l got a 100 foot extension cord which had a good bit extra for the back yard) The grass was bagged and I could lift the "bag" easily. Oh, great News, the height adjuster for the wheels.... One handle cranks ALL 4 wheels at the same time. AND IT IS EASY, LIGHT, AND ONE MOVEMENT! OMG! Hit the "Order Now" button!
customer_reviews.author: Andy Cave

customer_reviews.title: It’s electric boogie woogie
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mower because I was so tired of the gas /oil maintenance of my old broken mower. I purchased a 75 and 50 foot cord for the mower, my front yard is not large, and It holds together well while mowing. It seems as if the blades could be sharper, and I do have to go back on occasion to re-mow an area or 2. It’s obviously not as powerful as the gas mower and really, I’m only interested in keeping the front tidy and trim. It does a job, not the all time best, but...It gets it done.
customer_reviews.author: ellen

customer_reviews.title: bag catcher "doesn't)
customer_reviews.text: There is a design flaw with this mower! There is a 1/2 inch gap between the end of the grass catcher and the deck. I took pictures of the motor housing covered in grass after just 2' of mowing. This is Arizona, and our grass is dry this time of year, but I had to stop because I was already getting grass blow into my face, after just 2'! Will return!!!!
customer_reviews.author: C Baker

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working within 2 months!!
customer_reviews.text: Had to repair a part within the first month! Purchased the lawn mower in May, had to purchase a new part by June and by July the lawn mower completely stopped working! At this point, we had another (different brand) electric mower for over 2 years with no problems, we simply decided to get a larger mower and now regret not going with the original brand.
customer_reviews.author: Nik Stewart

customer_reviews.title: It quit, product support non-responsive
customer_reviews.text: Not happy. It was fine and relatively easy to push. Set up was easy, and it cut well. The cord was cumbersome, but that was expected. And then it stopped. Just died after two and a half uses. I contacted customer support 6 days ago, and got an automated acknowledgement, but no call or email. I got rid of the box already, and then it quit a few days later, of course. Waiting for them to advise on repair or return. Waiting. Waiting. Waiting.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: This came as dead on arrival
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after getting really good reviews from my friends and over here on Amazon. Looks like this was a piece not tested properly. The one I got did not turn on at all. Purchased the cable as recommended by green works. The mower did not show any sign of getting in action. Called the support. They asked me to do the same steps that I tried earlier and it was decided to return the unit. The return was hassle free as I was in 30 days window.
customer_reviews.author: Avi

customer_reviews.title: Great while it works but not worth the hassle
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Great mower for the price Cons: - Had one die after 10 months, had to wait a month for replacement - Second one died 11 months later - Gets out of balance easy - Customer support mixed. Pleasant and helpful, but takes > 1 hour to get through to anyone and there are no replacements available for a dead product for over a month and then I have to call back in again because they can't initiate the replacement now.
customer_reviews.author: Agamedes

customer_reviews.title: Dissappointed
customer_reviews.text: My Black and Decker went down after 12 years and I should have gotten another one. This does not feel sturdy and push it is like pushing a '56 Buick.
customer_reviews.author: Pangai

customer_reviews.title: Old lady’s choice
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Greenworks electrical mower. I knew I couldn’t start a mower with a pull starter so I opted for electric. Yes, getting used to the cord takes a minute but I would not have gone back to this same model when mine needed to be replaced if it were truly a hassle. My first mower lasted almost 4 mowing seasons. Have no complaints about needing a new one now. Easy to start. Does a great job mowing. I do recommend heavy duty extension cords. My yard is small. Takes about 40 minutes, or less, to mow front and back.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca M. Whitsett

customer_reviews.title: Now I can mow my yard by myself
customer_reviews.text: It did not take long for my husband to put it together. After reading reviews we did tape a piece of cardboard to cover the space between the plastic dome cover and the body of the mower so that the clippings won't get inside. It helps. This machine is very easy to start, to adjust the height of the grass cutting, easy to handle. You do have to figure out the cord. For my small front and back yard this machine is plenty powerful. I am really happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: V.D.

customer_reviews.title: Good power for a compact mower.
customer_reviews.text: I love the size of this mower. So easy to use. Not heavy and has lots of power. I bought a better power cord and googled how to know what kind of cord is best. It was an education for sure. I love the mulch option. I never use the catch bag. It is just too much trouble. That is why i gave only 4 stars on assembly. I had trouble attaching it. But i don't like to use it anyway. I always clean the underneath after each mow and it is ready for the next time.
customer_reviews.author: kimothy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble, use and store.
customer_reviews.text: I have only used once, but it fires right up (I guess powered on is the better description?). My grass was pretty tall so I set higher than usual and went down from there. No issues. It bagged it neatly. The assembly is easy and the handlebar folds down easily for storage. I will update if anything beads south, but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: A. Powers

customer_reviews.title: Works well!
customer_reviews.text: This little mower works quite well for it's small size and low price. It cuts all but the most wet and heavy grass with ease and bags quite well. It's light and easy to maneuver and I really like not having to buy and store gasoline anymore. I've used it a couple seasons now with no problems whatsoever. The only drawback is unrelated to the mower, but obviously an extension cord can be a bit of a pain to maneuver around. I've found the easiest way is to start mowing nearest the power outlet and then move side to side away from it results in the least fussing with the cord.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for this old lady.
customer_reviews.text: I am getting up in age, so I wanted something I could handle. I put it together myself and I mowed the lawn by myself. It's a fair size lawn so I needed one that could handle working around 6 citrus trees in the back yard. This machine is great! Cuts the lawn, kicks the rocks out of the way, and even ate the green extension cord so I could take a break! My very next purchase was a bright yellow extension cord. Yes, this is a great lawn mower!
customer_reviews.author: Jill Khollman

customer_reviews.title: The Grass Bag is useless
customer_reviews.text: I've had this mower for a few months now and for a electric mower I'm overall pretty impressed with it and at the price I paid you really can't beat it. My main complaint is the grass bag is pretty useless. So far in my experience the mower just does not throw the grass into the bag very well. I will see the grass being left behind on the ground when the bag has maybe 1/8th of a bag of grass. So I take the bag off and mow without it and rake if I need to.
customer_reviews.author: I DRM Free

customer_reviews.title: Impressed!
customer_reviews.text: Let me start off by saying This impressed me! I was not expecting much from a $159.00 lawn mower. Bags well, mulches well, cuts even. I have a 6900sq/ft lot with a moderate home. I have a 50’ 12 gauge cable I use for both front and back. Only con (I knew going into it) is moving about the yard with an extension cord gets old fast! Just maneuver around the yard and it’s not too bad. Very pleased! Good job guys on making an affordable product with quality results.
customer_reviews.author: Danman0614

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and manuver around the lawn
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad I made this purchase. This lawn mower has saved my shoulder from the strains of pulling on a cord. This product is light weight and easy to handle. I read other peoples reviews and took the recommendations they wrote. The method to better use this mower with the cord is to start mowing close to the house and mow outward away from the house where it is plugged in. This process keeps the cord from interfering too much with mowing the lawn. I live in south Texas where we have bermuda grass which is thick and I have not had any issues using this mower. I mow high so that helps as well.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Sanz

customer_reviews.title: Solid 4 stars
customer_reviews.text: It came today, the only assembly required was attaching the upper handle, and into the yard it went. Managing the electrical cord is not much more difficult than managing a gas mower; it is lightweight, easy to maneuver and did the job (my 2500sf lawn) with no trouble and no complaint. It is quiet (relative to a gas motor) and I hardly broke a sweat. With a flip of the levers attaching the upper handle, the entire handle folds down for storage. Solid 4 stars!
customer_reviews.author: tratl1963

customer_reviews.title: Gives a nice cut.
customer_reviews.text: Had shopped for an corded electric lawn mower for our 600 square ft of grass. Found Greenworks 20", 3 in 1, as I wanted a bagger. Used it this afternoon and really like it. Got a 100ft 15amp yellow extension cord so I would accidently run over the cord. The only thing is the outlet on the mower should be a 3 prong like the extension cord then cord would not come off as easy. Working through the learning curve using an electric and manuvering the cord around the yard. But overall, like it.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Lupkey

customer_reviews.title: Light and maneuvable, But.......
customer_reviews.text: This mower is probably designed for the grass to shoot out on it's side and NOT in the grass catcher. I asked them about addressing this (mower spitting out of the grass all over the place) problem and they told me to cut basically cut the grass twice. What a lame response..... meh
customer_reviews.author: T. Wong

customer_reviews.title: Cheap & pointlessly nasty
customer_reviews.text: Tell me, did you do an estimate of the added cost to use lock-washers, or Nylock nuts on all the fasteners, and found that it had an adverse effect on the Directors' bonuses? Or was it more basic than that - you assumed that if the machine rattled to bits after a year of light use, the sucker would come back and buy another one? Either way, your product is a POS. I don't know what I'll replace it with, but I'm sure it won't be something made by clowns.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny, not a professional mower, perfect for small yards
customer_reviews.text: Amazing lawn mower. It's small.. it's lightweight and with no batteries it lasts forever. Downside, it's not a professional lawnmower so it can't handle terribly thick grass. If your yard gets overgrown just take smaller passes and it's fine. Minor issues with clogging using the mulchin adapter, you need to clean it after EVERY use.. If you let it build up it will clog.. I just turn it over and use the leaf blower, works great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not for bigger or uneven lawns
customer_reviews.text: This item is good if the yard is small and perfectly flat. Even if that is the case, the cord is still a burden and constantly in the way. If you arent tripping on it, then you are running over it. I live in CA with sloped and rough yard. The grass is thick and would take multiple passes (like vacuuming) to cut it. I wouldnt recommend this product to anyone with a yard over 25 x 25 and not already in good condition.
customer_reviews.author: Iby Strong

customer_reviews.title: Perfect.  Much better than a gas mower.
customer_reviews.text: We have been using electric mowers for about 10 years now. They seem to last about three years with heavy use. So much less hassle than gas mowers - I will never go back. This particular one arrived with a small problem, but the Amazon agent solved the problem very quickly to my complete satisfaction. The mower works perfectly and only slows down if the grass is very thick and wet. Raising the cutting height by one notch restores normal cutting speed. I can cut our 1/2 acre in 20 - 30 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Charity

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to push.
customer_reviews.text: Small front wheels get stuck easily. Because it is corded, you spend a lot of time adjusting the cord. This is especially so when mowing on hills. With a corded mower, the drag of the cord adds to the weight you are pushing. This is more and indictment of corded mowers in general. I find the cord tends to get wrapped around rear wheels. Weight of machine is heavier than expected. Height adjustment is very easy. When mowing thick grass at low height mower almost slows to a halt. I would not recommend this mower.
customer_reviews.author: Connecticut Resident

customer_reviews.title: Great machine but...
customer_reviews.text: I love this little mower. It is lightweight and compact, for a small years its perfect. My issue is I was missing a part and couldn’t get anyone at customer service to answer. Finally I reached out to amazon and the amazon associate was great. She sent me another one. So the second was perfect. The issue could have been avoided if the customer service answered the phone. Other than that it’s a nice little unit.
customer_reviews.author: Annawee

customer_reviews.title: I do not recommend it!
customer_reviews.text: Under 4 months into using, stopped working, the electric something wrong with it, I called and ask them to send me to repair shop, they decline and said that model not eligible to repair-shop. we can replace it with the same model but we do not have now, wait until the end of August. I have to call then they will put me on waiting list!! that is bad. until the end of the summer.
customer_reviews.author: Adib Antour

customer_reviews.title: Bought it on June 30 2014. After 2 years ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought it on June 30 2014. After 2 years of normal use, it didnt start and tripped the breaker. Find out that the rectifier was dead, I replaced it. (Should call customer service for warranty but I did not ). Work again for over a year and now (03/28/2018) the motor spinning leaves a burning smell !!! It still has 3 months under its warranty but I’m so tired of it. Look for something else or claim your warranty first unless you want to buy another one in 2 or 3 years !!!
customer_reviews.author: Maikhoi Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: It pushes fairly easy and is light weight
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. The holder to keep the cord attached is not strong enough so we had to tie the around the handle to keep it from pulling free while mowing. It doesn't handle thick grass very well it bogs down. Also doesn't cut dewy grass without having to go over twice. Have used the mulcher and the rear bagger, not sure why I would ever use the side discharge. It pushes fairly easy and is light weight. We just take and blow everything off after we use it and put in the shed with the 100ft cord wrapped around the handle.
customer_reviews.author: DeDe Howard

customer_reviews.title: Different than a gas mower.
customer_reviews.text: Found that small circular patterns are esier to xontrol the cable. I have a 100ft 12g cable, which delivers smooth power but is too big for the strain relief on this mower, so I tie it on the crossbar and that works. Mower cut bag can grab a lot of grass, but that makes it heavy, so I dump the bag more often. Starts immediately, runs quiet, bags great. My little Brigs mower is better for real heavy cutting, but it is hard to get started and dies often around overhanging areas.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Alfred

customer_reviews.title: Strength Beyond Strength
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this thing for two mowing seasons and so far I'm extremely impressed. I was a little hesitant in going electric because I questioned an electric mower's ability to get through the really tall grass that I tend to let get out of hand, but I can honestly say that this is the most powerful mower that I've ever used. I sometimes let my back yard get close to knee high and as I found out yesterday - my greenworks mower powered right through it. Sure, it slows down when you get to patches that high, but even the high end gas mower that I borrowed from my neighbor stalled out in grass this high.
customer_reviews.author: Nidstang

customer_reviews.title: Great for a small yard
customer_reviews.text: This is a great mower for a small yard. Having a slightly large backyard that had some ankle high grass/weed I could feel this mower struggling a bit. The RPMs started dipping when I got into the thick of it and I had to pull back and go over the same spot a few times. Having the cord is also a bit of a pain, but you get used to it. It gets tied up on various objects and you have to go and grab it, but that’s to be expected with a corded machine. Overall, I’m happy with this product. It gets the job done, albeit less conveniently than it’s gas or battery powered brethren.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Only used it twice...GREAT DISAPPOINTMENT...
customer_reviews.text: I dislike this product because I was only able to use it twice. It started out wonderfully both times that I used it to cut grass. (I also have a small garden.) When I wanted to use a third time, it did not turn on at all. I also bought a new extension cord for it and it is still not turning on. It's completely dead. Sitting in a corner now, brand new and unusable...terrible waste of money and time.
customer_reviews.author: L&M

customer_reviews.title: So Easy!
customer_reviews.text: This mower is awesome! Our favorite feature is the easy push start. The cord can be a little annoying but be bought an extra long extension cord and just pay attention. The grass catcher works really well too. We can do our entire yard before needing to dump it. It catches everything and there aren't any grass debri lines. The mower is pretty light and easy to move around. I lactually look forward to mowing the lawn every week. Note, we don't have the best lawn and this mower handles stickers and tall weeds like a champ.
customer_reviews.author: CRunk

customer_reviews.title: Excellent lawn mower
customer_reviews.text: I mowed our overgrown lawn in about 30 minutes. It looked smooth and professionally cut. It mowed through grass over a foot high with ease. The bag caught most of the clippings and had to be emptied many times. I eventually got tired of emptying it and mowed half without it. I'm very pleased with how it performs. The cord management is something you have to get used to. Hauling a cord around was probably the hardest part about using this corded lawn mower! I figured out a good method to avoid running the cord over and make sure it stayed plugged in.
customer_reviews.author: E Alegria

customer_reviews.title: Everything I want in a lawn mower
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase of this particular mower, the first had a long life and performed very well. It would still be in use if we could've fixed a wheel that failed beyond our repair, the motor and everything else still works great. I love the easy start, light weight handling, and quiet operation. I like the fact that you don't have to use gas or oil and that this mower is extremely low maintenance.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa N.

customer_reviews.title: Just got it - I'm surprised!
customer_reviews.text: It was delivered today and my first thought was gee, the box is a lot heaver than I would have guessed it to be... Opened it up, put it together (so easy a caveman could do it), plugged it in with a 16/3 25ft extension and mowed my 14' x 20' lawn that has grown quite long - at least 8"+ Did a perfect job. I haven't pushed a mower in 40-years and I guess I thought "electric" mowers were light flimsy under-powered junk - not this mower, this is the real McCoy and it won't blow away in a wind gust! Absolutely happy with it so far but I will add addenda as we go!
customer_reviews.author: Karl

customer_reviews.title: Will never use a gas mower again!
customer_reviews.text: Great mower and powerful enough to cut tall grass. Quick and easy to use height adjustment. Plug and go - no prep. I’ll never go back to a gas mower again.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Jackson

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Just took it out of the box and assembled it. Either the frame is bend, or the wheel carriage is misaligned. Either way, this mower is far from level. I'm sending it back immediately. This situation was a bit of a godsend though because had it been aligned correctly I would have used it. And it may have been fine. But looking at the quality of this thing, it's definitely cheap. Even when the handle is screwed tight, and the quick-release cams are down, this handle is pretty rickety. Huge gaps with the bag installed. There's a reason this thing is cheap, and it starts with craftsmanship and quality. I don't think I'll be ordering a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Kreisleriana

customer_reviews.title: 3 Years and Going Strong!
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant switching from gas to electric, but well worth it. I have a small lawn (1500 sq ft) and not having to maintain a gas mower is great. It starts up first time, every time. I even leave it outside (in AZ) and although the labels are fading, it works like a champ. It is lightweight but mulches and bags surprisingly well. I can blow everything from the rocks into the grass and this cleans it up well. Cords are only a minor bother at first, but you should get it figured out quickly. Highly recommended, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Mrozek

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t used this personally but my husband has mowed our lawn several times since we bought this. He uses it with a 100-foot extension cord. It cuts very well and was able to handle tall grass with no problem. His arms did ache after the first time using this, mainly due to having to maneuver the extension cord. We have a large yard, with the front part on a slope. The lawnmower was able to handle the job. No complaints except for managing the cord while cutting.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mows great
customer_reviews.text: The mower really works well. I had not mowed the yard for a couple of weeks and was concerned. Our yard in think fine grass. The 12 amp motor did great! Did Not bog down. This mower really cuts well. The clippings are more of a mulch, very small pieces. I use the bag and it fills slowly due to the finesse of the cut. I empty the bag long before its full. Its just easier to empty. Once full, its a bit of a hassle to get the clipping out. We have a small to medium yard. I empty the bag 4 times and it does not fill a garbage bag. Great mower and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this mower if you are planning on using it more than 1x
customer_reviews.text: Motor assembly blew after 4 mows. That’s after having to replace a couple other screws that just fell off in the first few mows. The assembly split 35 days from when I bought it. So no refund. Amazon was helpful and put me on with greenworks. Green works was rude and unhelpful. Said they’d send me a new mower in 10-14 business days. I said I need to mow my lawn before then is there an alternative option and she said no and hung up on me.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Died-but Customer Service was Quick to Send A New One!
customer_reviews.text: So far, this is working great. It's a bit noisy for an electric, but I wasn't looking for a quiet machine, just one that cuts the lawn, and this is doing fine. That's what I wrote when I bought it two years ago, but last week, it just stopped, tripping my circuit breakers as well. I called customer service today, and though I spent about 40 minutes on hold (I blame the coronavirus) once the Customer Service Rep came on, she was quick to address the issue. Thanks to Amazon, I had my sales information, which I forwarded to the Rep. She is sending me a new machine that should arrive here next week. Very pleased with Customer Service!
customer_reviews.author: Rick Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good! Easy to put together and had no issues with it. We dont have a very big back yard, but we do have a lot of weeds. It worked great cutting them down. We use the high setting and switch to the lower ones afterwards. Will update if we have any issues
customer_reviews.author: De'aundrue Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Received badly damaged. Deck bent at 3 places,handle bent,shipping box not from mfg'r
customer_reviews.text: I dislike that the product arrived totally destroyed and unusable. It wasn't even the manufacturer's original shipping carton. The shipping box had about 5 layers of tape covering the box opening flaps and box handles. This was just a mess but probably not the manufacturer's fault.
customer_reviews.author: WildBill

customer_reviews.title: Dust and Dirt Storm
customer_reviews.text: Great machine, EXCEPT the grass catcher bag has a 1/2 inch gap all along the top which allows clippings and a dust cloud to be released back into the wild, creating a roaring mess on me, on the mower, through the open windows of the vicinity. If I had known, I would have gotten a different mower.
customer_reviews.author: TanukiHeights

customer_reviews.title: Died in 1 season
customer_reviews.text: Lasted 1 season. This is a "you get what you pay for product. I had to fix it twice during it's first summer and it caught a root the first mow of it's second season and cracked the motor mount. When it works, it doesn't cope well with thick or tall grass. It's cumbersome to handle and dealing with the cord is never fun.
customer_reviews.author: Abraham Lender

customer_reviews.title: It is good for my purposes
customer_reviews.text: I have a small yard to cut. This works very well for my purposes. I had to get a 100ft extension cord must be properly rated. Having to jokey the cord around is kind of annoying at times however, no dealing with fuel and maintenance headaches of a vas mower.... also no batteries to deal with. Overall it has a great adjustment set and is a good option for small yards.
customer_reviews.author: William L. Drewel Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Love to use the little green machine.
customer_reviews.text: I have a small yard and this lawnmower works very well. Cuts grass that looks even and well groomed. Having a cord to watch out for is a learning curve. I can cut my lawn in 25 to 30 minutes and the bagger works well. No trimming left behind. I have noticed clipping building under the cover and I needed to take the cover off and blow away the build up now and then. easy to do. My only issue is the cords locking device does not fit thicker cords. I made my own and it works well. I would not use this unit for large lawns.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy that this mower is lighter than most
customer_reviews.text: Happy that this mower is lighter than most. But, the downside is that it is fairly flimsy. Handle bent upon first use. Built with lots of plastic. Also bolts are beginning to rust in first season even though stored in garage.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Durability?
customer_reviews.text: Had this three months and the bolts are loosening and getting lost. Now I know you need to retighten them frequently or better yet get better bolts without plastic nut piece. Does it’s job. We will see about durability.
customer_reviews.author: Karco

customer_reviews.title: The mower worked well, but after exactly one season ...
customer_reviews.text: The mower worked well, but after exactly one season, it just STOPPED. Wouldn't work at all. I called the manufacturer and spent 40 minutes on hold. They told me they would send me a new mower (!!!), but it would take at least three weeks before I received it. And DO NOT USE THIS with the heavy-duty extension cord advertised with the Amazon listing. I bought that heavy cord and it would not fit in the "cord-holders" on the mower, so it weighed down the starter. I think this is what caused the started to SHORT OUT.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara  from Buffalo

customer_reviews.title: Just a notch below what a gas mower can do
customer_reviews.text: I have about .6 acres of yard of well established Kentucky bluegrass. This mower works great as long as I double back on every cut. If I try to cut in the highest setting, it misses a lot of grass. It looks awful when I'm finished. I find that I have to go a notch lower and still double back for best results. The bag hold a lot of grass. It's super light and easy to maneuver. If I didn't have to double back, it would be 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: A little hard to turn with all 4 wheels on the ground. I find it easier to turn if I tip the mower onto the rear wheels and pivot it on the rear wheels. Not too difficult to do. Cuts pretty well. The clip for the extension cord is too small - you're supposed to loop the cord into the clip - it's way too small to put the cord thru. Not a huge deal, I loop the cords around the handle.
customer_reviews.author: H.Y.

customer_reviews.title: Needs a few tweaks
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to assemble and mows well. But what I don’t care for is that after every use I need to remove the motor cover and blow the lawn clippings out. Hopefully I can find a way to stop this from happening
customer_reviews.author: Tealtownfan

customer_reviews.title: Great Mower!
customer_reviews.text: This lawn mower was easy to set up and works great. The very little extra work of managing the cord and extension cord is well worth the savings in cost to us over battery powered mowers. We'd hoped to see it in person before purchasing it online, but could not find corded mowers locally. Delivery to our door was quick and easy on Amazon.com. We did have one issue with it suddenly not starting after using it just a few times without problems, and GreenWorks' staff solved the problem by phone quickly and efficiently. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Her Excellence

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this mower
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this mower. I converted from a push mower, and while I miss not having to be corded, this is way more efficient and I can manage to mow the grass about 3x as fast as with the push mower (and much less stress). I like the options for side discharge or capture bag as well - and use them depending on how tall the grass has gotten (side discharge for low/slow growth, and v.v.). I'd recommend it. Make sure you get a long, outdoor extension cord with the proper gauge rating.
customer_reviews.author: N. Pappas

customer_reviews.title: Does the job well, and is so light
customer_reviews.text: I have a gas mower whose self-propelling mechanism is not dependable. The Greenworks corded mower is so light that you can easily push it up inclines and around other tricky terrain. The power cord is always a hassle, but less of a hassle than constant battery-charging or dealing with gasoline. Motor is surprisingly loud for an electric. Overall, a sturdy and welcome addition to our tool shed!
customer_reviews.author: Claudia

customer_reviews.title: Low Cost, High-end mower
customer_reviews.text: This mower uses a cord, which isn't ideal, but for the amount of money, this is an EXCELLENT mower. We knew before buying it used a cord, but we needed a new mower and wanted something that would be better for the environment. This mower is extremely low weight, easy to start, easy to use, and has safety features so injury can be prevented. It's also very quiet, which is nice when you're trying to mow in the morning before the Florida sun gets too hot. It also has mulching capability, so you can fertilize as you go. All-in-all, this is an excellent, cost effective mower.
customer_reviews.author: Cathi Kilian

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good.
customer_reviews.text: Once I got used to having the cord following me everywhere, it was quite nice. I'm sure the neighbors forgive me for the few choice words I yelled before I got used to it. It's awesome to be able to start the mower so fast. No more pulling cords, messing with oil, or filling it up with gas. It runs great and is actually a little quieter than other mowers I've used.
customer_reviews.author: Les Bohlen

product_meta.title: Greenworks 20-Inch 3-in-1 12 Amp Electric Corded Lawn Mower 25022
product_meta.description: Greenworks 25022 Features: 3-in-1 mowing capabilities - mulching, rear collection and side discharge. 20 in. wide cutting path offers a great balance of maneuverability and cutting capacity for mid sized areas. Powerful 12 Amp motor provides tough cutting and mulching power. Rugged stamped steel cutting deck provides added durability. Adjustable cutting height with 7 various positions from 1.5 in. up to 3.75 in.. Cam lock handle for easy folding and storage of unit. Integrated cord lock helps prevents accidental cord disconnects. Ideal for mid-sized yards and lawns.
feature_bullets: Electric corded mower with a powerful 12 Amp motor (extension cord not included)
7-position height adjustment offers a range of cutting height from 1-1/2 to 3-3/4 inches for all grass types
Push button start. Drive system: Manual

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars6,110 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
